ygData.subject: Re: Enchanters and Research *** SPOILER ***
ygData.msgSnippet: Arg, I knew it!  I was just in Felwithe and am now bound in Freeport. heh  It s an easy trip just takes a while on the boat.  Speaking of the boat it s fun to
ygData.messageBody:
Arg, I knew it! I was just in Felwithe and am now bound in Freeport.
heh It's an easy trip just takes a while on the boat. Speaking of the
boat it's fun to watch people swimming on the deck and siren isle is
nice to drive by.

-----Original Message-----
From: Rob Berryhill [mailto:racefan@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 1:24 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Enchanters and Research *** SPOILER ***


From: "Rob Berryhill" <racefan@...>

They are available at most of the Enchanter guilds - in Felwithe and
Erudin
for sure.

Djar Lightbringer, Chancellor of HOA (Tarew Marr Server)
Servant of Light, Deliverer of the Truth to Norrath
http://www.hoa-rpg.com/

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Shawn Alley [mailto:ShawnA@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 1:00 PM
> To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Enchanters and Research *** SPOILER ***
>
>
> From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
>
> WOW THANKS! This is great information. Would I have seen any of
these
> so far in my normal travels or are they stashed away some where? I'm
> saving your message into my keep folder. :)
>
> My friend told me he heard some texts are written in a foreign
language
> and you have to learn it somehow before you can understand. He
> mentioned needing to hear the language spoken once to understand and
> that you sometimes would need to seek out an exotic creature that
spoke
> that language. Not sure if rumor or conjecture but I thought I'd
offer
> anyway.
>
> Shawn
> Azara, high elf enchantress
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Rob Berryhill [mailto:racefan@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 12:21 AM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Enchanters and Research *** SPOILER ***
>
>
> From: "Rob Berryhill" <racefan@...>
>
> We have 3 "books" that I have found, two are actually containers, and
> they
> are as follows:
>
> 1> Book of Ancient Restoration - This has two slots for restoring
> damaged
> pages.
> 2> Tome of Endless Enchantments - This is the thing to use for spell
> research. You put in a page (or two for some spells), a parchment and
a
> quill and combine.
> 3> The End of an Age - this is our "recipe" book. Basically it states
> that
> we need to assemble the tomes of several members of an ancient circle
of
> Keepers of the Craft. Two of which are Tasarian and Velishoul.
>
> Djar Lightbringer, Chancellor of HOA (Tarew Marr Server)
> Servant of Light, Deliverer of the Truth to Norrath
> http://www.hoa-rpg.com/
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: DeGirolami, Franck [mailto:degirolami@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 5:57 PM
> > To: Eqenchanters (E-mail)
> > Subject: [eqenchanters] Enchanters and Research
> >
> >
> > From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
> >
> > When I had my level 16 necro, I started some research ( barely
> > really ) and
> > went to the multiple guilds to buy some books. I've noticed then
that
> all
> > guild have about 5 volumes for research, except the enchanters
> > who have only
> > 2...or maybe 3..not sure. Do we have less research ability or are
our
> > various research books in a lot of various places just like our
> spells?
> > Skara the Enchantress
> >
> >
> >
>
